intro: Caraguata morreniana, commonly known as the Morren's caraguata, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
